roleset.name: get rid of

role.descr: agent, entity getting rid of something
instrument or manner, if separate from agent

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Armstrong-1 said that *trace*-1 disposing of the carpet business would improve ``total financial performance.''

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: In this clause of the statement he is assuring the minds of dealers that does not intend to dispose of his shares to them through this action of his , and so they should enter and raise up the index of his companies .

example.name: Args 0 and 1
example.text: our use and disposal of precious natural resources

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: the discontinued operations and disposal of its Fine Homes International Limited Partnership real-estate subsidiary
example.arg: of its Fine Homes International Limited Partnership real-estate subsidiary

roleset.note: DISPOSE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'dispose' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. Comparison with 'unload'. (from dispose.01-v predicate notes)
DISPOSAL-N NOTES: Based on nouns-00080. Comparison to 'dispose.01' No Vn class. Framed by Katie. (from disposal.01-n)

roleset.name: (be) prepare(d)

role.descr: prepared for what, kind of disposition

example.name: dispose-v
example.text: His strong conservative tendencies led him to oppose the doctrine of free trade, and disposed him to hail the coup d'état and the new empire.
example.arg: to hail the coup d'état and the new empire.

example.name: disposed-j
example.text: If we look at the situation this way , we can get an idea of Khrushchev 's nightmarish worries -- or , at least , of the worries [0] he might have []if his enemies were disposed [*-2] to exploit their advantage .

example.name: disposition
example.text: Socrates' superiority lay not so much in what he did as in his disposition to act justly towards men and reverently towards the gods
example.arg: to act justly towards men and reverently towards the gods

roleset.note: DISPOSE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'dispose' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. Comparison with 'unload'. (from dispose.02-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: availability

example.name: arg0
example.text: Does he have a car at his disposal or should I put you in touch with some peeps ?

roleset.note: DISPOSAL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from disposal.02-n)
